message.content: Yes, the authors do discuss potential negative societal impacts of their work. They mention that with the full thinking hierarchy of the crowds, it may be easier to implement social media manipulation of public opinion.

Yes, the authors do discuss potential negative societal impacts of their work. They mention that their methodology could make it easier to implement social media manipulation of public opinion with the full thinking hierarchy of the crowds, which can be harmful.

Yes, the authors discuss potential negative societal impacts of their work. They mention that with the full thinking hierarchy of the crowds, it may be easier to implement social media manipulation of public opinion. This acknowledges the potential for misuse of their proposed method in influencing public discourse in a negative manner.
